clinical_study.brief_title: Prebiotics as a Means to Modulate Gut Fermentation, Metabolism, Appetite and Cognition
clinical_study.official_title: Prebiotics as Means to Modulate Colonic Events, With the Purpose to Increase Beneficial Effects on Metabolism, Satiety and Cognition.

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims at investigating the impact of colonic fermentation of intrinsic indigestible carbohydrates in cereal whole kernels after three days consumption, on metabolic variables and cognition. The study is performed in healthy, normal to slightly over-weight test subjects.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) of the test meal
primary_outcome.description: The differences in AUC between different risk markers, assessed in plasma or serum,after intake of the test meal in comparison to the reference meal is measured. Example of variables measured are glucose, insulin, appetite hormones, inflammatory markers, markers of colonic fermentation.

secondary_outcome.description: The cognitive performance of the test subjects is measured to investigate work memory and specific attention.
The subjective sensation of satiety, hunger and desire to eat is measured using a questionnaire.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI 19-28 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- gastrointestinal diseases
- metabolic disorders
- tobacco/snuff user
- antibiotic/probiotic treatment
